data.title: Official Top 250 Narrative Feature Films
data.meta_description: A list of 250 films compiled on Letterboxd, including Harakiri (1962), Come and See (1985), 12 Angry Men (1957), Seven Samurai (1954) and The Godfather Part II (1974). About this list: Letterboxd's Top 250 movies, based on the average weighted rating of all Letterboxd users. I removed all stand-up specials, stage plays, concert films, documentaries, shorts, 'collection listings' and other 'rarities', so only feature length narrative movies are listed here. Films should have a minimum of 5,000 ratings to be eligible to enter the list. As a sister to this list, we also have a Top 50 films with less than 5,000 ratings, so be sure to check out the more obscure gems there! My friend Jack Moulton made a list of Letterboxd Top 250 documentaries, go check it out! And last but not least there is a companion piece to this list with all films that were once part of the Top 250. A few statistics... The oldest movie on the list is Buster Keaton's Sherlock Jr., released in 1924. The most popular decade in the list is the 1990's with 41 entries. A complete overview: 1920's - 4 entries 1930's - 4 entries 1940's - 15 entries 1950's - 37 entries 1960's - 34 entries 1970's - 23 entries 1980's - 26 entries 1990's - 41 entries 2000's - 34 entries 2010's - 19 entries 2020's - 13 entries Akira Kurosawa seems to be Letterboxd's most popular director, with 9 entries in the list, of which 4 in the top 20. Next in line with 7 titles is Bergman. All popular directors: 9 entries - Akira Kurosawa 7 entries - Ingmar Bergman 6 entries - Billy Wilder, Andrei Tarkovsky 5 entries - Stanley Kubrick, Masaki Kobayashi 4 entries - Christopher Nolan, Abbas Kiarostami, Martin Scorsese, Hirokazu Kore-eda 3 entries - Quentin Tarantino, Peter Jackson, Francis Ford Coppola, Charlie Chaplin, Federico Fellini, Hideaki Anno, Sidney Lumet, David Lean, Hayao Miyazaki, Alfred Hitchcock, Emeric Pressburger & Michael Powell, Wong Kar-wai, Satyajit Ray, Theo Angelopoulos, Wim Wenders, Denis Villeneuve, Yasujirō Ozu Fun fact: Highest ranked movies in IMDb's top 250 that are absent in the Letterboxd list: Forrest Gump (12), Inception (15), The Matrix (17), Star Wars (29) and Back to the Future (30). Latest update: August 26, 2024 Back in the list: Swing Girls at #250 Gone, not forgotten: Kwaidan
data.text:
Letterboxd's Top 250 movies, based on the average weighted rating of all Letterboxd users. I removed all stand-up specials, stage plays, concert films, documentaries, shorts, 'collection listings' and other 'rarities', so only feature length narrative movies are listed here. Films should have a minimum of 5,000 ratings to be eligible to enter the list.

As a sister to this list, we also have a Top 50 films with less than 5,000 ratings, so be sure to check out the more obscure gems there!

My friend Jack Moulton made a list of Letterboxd Top 250 documentaries, go check it out!

And last but not least there is a companion piece to this list with all films that were once part of…

Letterboxd's Top 250 movies, based on the average weighted rating of all Letterboxd users. I removed all stand-up specials, stage plays, concert films, documentaries, shorts, 'collection listings' and other 'rarities', so only feature length narrative movies are listed here. Films should have a minimum of 5,000 ratings to be eligible to enter the list.

As a sister to this list, we also have a Top 50 films with less than 5,000 ratings, so be sure to check out the more obscure gems there!

My friend Jack Moulton made a list of Letterboxd Top 250 documentaries, go check it out!

And last but not least there is a companion piece to this list with all films that were once part of the Top 250.

A few statistics...

The oldest movie on the list is Buster Keaton's Sherlock Jr., released in 1924. The most popular decade in the list is the 1990's with 41 entries. A complete overview:

1920's - 4 entries

1930's - 4 entries

1940's - 15 entries

1950's - 37 entries

1960's - 34 entries

1970's - 23 entries

1980's - 26 entries

1990's - 41 entries

2000's - 34 entries

2010's - 19 entries

2020's - 13 entries

Akira Kurosawa seems to be Letterboxd's most popular director, with 9 entries in the list, of which 4 in the top 20. Next in line with 7 titles is Bergman.

All popular directors:

9 entries - Akira Kurosawa

7 entries - Ingmar Bergman

6 entries - Billy Wilder, Andrei Tarkovsky

5 entries - Stanley Kubrick, Masaki Kobayashi

4 entries - Christopher Nolan, Abbas Kiarostami, Martin Scorsese, Hirokazu Kore-eda

3 entries - Quentin Tarantino, Peter Jackson, Francis Ford Coppola, Charlie Chaplin, Federico Fellini, Hideaki Anno, Sidney Lumet, David Lean, Hayao Miyazaki, Alfred Hitchcock, Emeric Pressburger & Michael Powell, Wong Kar-wai, Satyajit Ray, Theo Angelopoulos, Wim Wenders, Denis Villeneuve, Yasujirō Ozu

Fun fact:

Highest ranked movies in IMDb's top 250 that are absent in the Letterboxd list: Forrest Gump (12), Inception (15), The Matrix (17), Star Wars (29) and Back to the Future (30).

Latest update: August 26, 2024

Back in the list:

Swing Girls at #250

Gone, not forgotten:

Kwaidan
